Package application

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
application.Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
The controller class is responsible for the changes that happen in the graphical user interface. It takes in the information that is used to execute the methods in the company class, and outputs necessary results and messages.
Author:
Ceceliachollette-Dickson, Nidaansari

    • inputtedEmpProfile

      private Profile inputtedEmpProfile​(javafx.event.ActionEvent profileEvent)
      This method creates a profile object which will be returned so an employee of any type can be made.
      Parameters:
      profileEvent - takes in the necessary information to create a profile.
      Returns:
      the profile to be used when creating an employee.

    • importedEmployees

      private void importedEmployees​(java.lang.String[] employeeInfo)
      A helper method for importFile to help scan in the information to the text area.
      Parameters:
      employeeInfo - contains the information of an employee.

    • checkAnnualSalary

      private boolean checkAnnualSalary​(javafx.scene.control.TextField annualSalary)
      Method to check if the annual salary of a fulltime or manager employee is valid.
      Parameters:
      annualSalary - contains a fulltime or manager employee's annual salary
      Returns:
      boolean that signals if the salary was valid or not

    • checkHourlyRate

      private boolean checkHourlyRate​(javafx.scene.control.TextField hourlyRate)
      Method to check if the hourly rate of a part time employee is valid.
      Parameters:
      hourlyRate - contains the rate of a part time employee in textfield format.
      Returns:
      boolean that signals if the hourly rate is valid or not.

      Parameters:
      event - is the Export button in the graphical user interface.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file is not found

    • fulltime

      void fulltime​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This disables the fields that are not required for a full time employee, such as hourly rate, hours worked, set hours, and managerial role.
      Parameters:
      event - is the full time button in the graphical user interface.
